strings: <se_low>Yangus: I reckon you should live in a big posh mansion like this one day, guv.

<se_low>Yangus: I've got 'igh 'opes for you, y'know.
You deserve to 'ave somewhere nice.
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue wot bigwigs are thinkin' sometimes.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, the view may be awright an' all that, but it's 'ardly the most ‘conv'ent’ place in the world.<page>Yangus: Why would anyone wanna live all the way up 'ere!?
<se_high>Jessica: I can't believe I'm actually saying this, but I owe my mother some thanks for all those years of drilling proper manners into me.

<se_high>Jessica: Speaking of which, what DOES happen to people who don't behave properly in front of the Lord High Priest?<page>Jessica: Life imprisonment?
Squashed by the Goddess's giant thumb?

<se_high>Jessica: The air is so fresh and crisp up here!
I love the mountains. I can't even remember the last time I felt this good!
<se_high>Jessica: And the sun feels so warm. I could stay up here forever!

<se_def>Angelo: This place is enormous.
There are plenty of Templars on duty, mind.
And they all look fairly fearsome, too.

<se_def>Angelo: Good old Captain Marcello, eh?
He may have the social skills of a darkodile, but he certainly knows how to do his job.

<se_def>Angelo: I never imagined I'd visit the Lord High Priest's residence while I was alive.
Life takes some funny turns.
<se_def>Angelo: All the time back at the abbey, people said he lived above the clouds, you see. ...Now I realise they meant up here, not ‘up there’!
<se_low>Yangus: It's a bit dark, so I ain't sure, but that mansion's where the Lord 'Igh Priest lives, right?

<se_low>Yangus: Crikey. Of all the places for a man like me to be!
There must be some great treasure in there!
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't got a clue wot bigwigs are thinkin' sometimes.
<se_low>Yangus: I mean, the view may be awright an' all that, but it's 'ardly the most ‘conv'ent’ place in the world.<page>Yangus: Why would anyone wanna live all the way up 'ere!?
<se_high>Jessica: Don't you think it's a bit rude to turn up on the Lord High Priest's doorstep in the dead of night? Why don't we come back during the day?

<se_high>Jessica: But if you insist, don't let me stop you.
I can't imagine they're going to lavish us with tea and biscuits, though.

<se_high>Jessica: The air is so fresh and crisp up here!
I love the mountains. I can't even remember the last time I felt this good!
<se_high>Jessica: And the sun feels so warm. I could stay up here forever!

<se_def>Angelo: This place is enormous.
There are plenty of Templars on duty, mind.
And they all look fairly fearsome, too.

<se_def>Angelo: Good old Captain Marcello, eh?
He may have the social skills of a darkodile, but he certainly knows how to do his job.

<se_def>Angelo: I never imagined I'd visit the Lord High Priest's residence while I was alive.
Life takes some funny turns.
<se_def>Angelo: All the time back at the abbey, people said he lived above the clouds, you see. ...Now I realise they meant up here, not ‘up there’!
<se_low>King Trode: Goodness!
<se_low>King Trode: If I'm not mistaken, that's the Lord High Priest's mansion! Now's our chance to drop a few hints about Trodain, <leader>!

<se_low>King Trode: We can't let this opportunity go to waste!
We may even be able to persuade His Holiness to attend Medea's wedding!

<se_low>King Trode: Just for your information, I wasn't trying to listen in.
No, no, I'd never stoop to such a level.
<se_low>King Trode: But one can hardly help overhearing something by accident, can one? Ha ha hah!
<se_low>Yangus: I ain't that keen on Marcello, but I can't say I go for them bigwigs preachin' at me, neither!

<se_low>Yangus: This place is gettin' to me more an' more!
I'm itchin' like I've got fleas comin' outta me ears now!

<se_high>Jessica: See!? That's what you get, Marcello!
You can't act like a jerk forever!

<se_high>Jessica: That was fun to watch!
I've got a feeling this is going to be a good day!

<se_def>Angelo: How does he manage it...?
The Lord High Priest certainly seems to have taken to him.

<se_def>Angelo: Maybe that's for the best.
He needs someone keeping an eye on him like Abbot Francisco always did.

<se_low>Yangus: The Lord 'Igh Priest is so...so...I dunno!
So important! So respected, like!
Ya can see it in 'is face.
<se_low>Yangus: Uhh... I feel a bit shaky on me old pins, guv!

<se_high>Jessica: The greater the person, the more they humble themselves. What is that old saying?
‘The boughs that bear most, hang lowest’?
<se_high>Jessica: Anyway, if the black dog...I mean Rhapthorne!<page>Jessica: If Rhapthorne has his sights on the Lord High Priest, we can't let our guard down for an instant.

<se_high>Jessica: I only had a chance to speak with the Lord High Priest briefly, but it was enough make me think that the world's a better place with him in it.<page>Jessica: We can't let anything happen to him!
<se_def>Angelo: His Holiness is a bit like Abbot Francisco, in a way. I don't mean how he looks, but... I don't know. There's a certain air about him.
<se_def>Angelo: It's been a long time since I left the abbey, and today's the first time I've felt any pangs of missing the place.
<se_low>Yangus: An 'igh-up place surrounded by mountains... Oh!

<se_low>Yangus: I've got it, guv! That's it!
Now I feel daft for not gettin' it before!

<se_high>Jessica: So there are still places out there we haven't visited yet!?
I thought we'd already seen the entire world!

<se_high>Jessica: That really annoys me.
When I go on a trip, I want to be able to say I've seen everything.
<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. The black dog could well be hiding there, so we'd better have a look!
<se_def>Angelo: Sixty one points. About average.

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? I'm talking about that girl.
Maybe you'd rate her a bit higher?
Each to his own.
<se_low>Yangus: An 'igh-up place surrounded by mountains... Oh!

<se_low>Yangus: I've got it, guv! That's it!
Now I feel daft for not gettin' it before!

<se_high>Jessica: So there are still places out there we haven't visited yet!?
I thought we'd already seen the entire world!

<se_high>Jessica: That really annoys me.
When I go on a trip, I want to be able to say I've seen everything.
<se_high>Jessica: Whatever. The black dog could well be hiding there, so we'd better have a look!
<se_def>Angelo: Sixty one points. About average.

<se_def>Angelo: Hm? I'm talking about that girl.
Maybe you'd rate her a bit higher?
Each to his own.
<se_low>Yangus: I was a bit careless before, but nuffin' gets past ol' Yangus more than once!
<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv! Let's sock it to that miserable mongrel once an' for all!

<se_low>Yangus: Grrr....!
I won't let that mongrel get away wiv this!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv! Let's do it!
You're the only one who can show that beast who's boss!
<se_low>Yangus: Fancy that mongrel breakin' in through the window like that! Where's 'is manners, eh? Anyone'd think he was a no-good thief!

<se_low>Yangus: Come on, guv!
Let's catch up wiv 'im and give 'im a bit o' ‘trainin'’! Heh heh!

<se_low>Yangus: This is it, eh guv! Hah hah!
I'm so excited, I've got flies in me stomach!

<se_low>Yangus: The littlest thing now could be the diff'rence between life 'n' death.
Better not mess nuffin' up, eh!?
<se_high>Jessica: I'm so angry, I can't stop shaking.

<se_high>Jessica: We can't afford to let it strike again!
I won't PERMIT it to strike again!<page>Jessica: No more death and suffering!
We have to stop that damn dog!

<se_high>Jessica: If we all work together, nothing can stop us from defeating Rhapthorne.
Right, <hero>?
<se_high>Jessica: Let's promise each other that we're going to win, and that we're all going to make it back safe and sound!
<se_high>Jessica: We found him!

<se_high>Jessica: Here we go, guys!
Just let me at him!<page>Jessica: I'm finally going to take revenge for what happened to Alistair and all the other victims!

<se_high>Jessica: Where did that mutt go!?
Come out and show your face, you cheat!
COME ON!
<se_high>Jessica: Where did that stupid dog go? We can't let it get away!
<se_def>Angelo: We don't have much choice.

<se_def>Angelo: He made easy work of those Templars.
And they're supposed to be the strongest of the bunch.

<se_def>Angelo: So it looks like the task falls to us.
Fantastic.
That dog's far too strong for my liking.
<se_def>Angelo: The dog flew in through the upstairs middle window, right?

<se_def>Angelo: That's bad news!
I'm sure it's the Lord High Priest's chamber!

<se_def>Angelo: If we don't manage to save His Holiness...
It doesn't bear thinking about!
The world would surely fall to pieces.

<se_def>Angelo: This is the biggest responsibility we've ever had.<page>Angelo: I can almost hear my shoulders creaking under the burden of it already.
I don't know if I can do this...

<se_def>Angelo: Hah hah! Don't look so worried!
I'm only joking! Let's just give it our best shot, okay?

<se_low>King Trode: We did it!
We caught up with that fiendish black dog!
<se_low>King Trode: ...Er, so now the rest is up to you!

<se_low>King Trode: Bish bash bosh...
Do whatever it is you do and defeat him so that we can finally be rid of this terrible curse!<page>King Trode: Consider that the King's orders!

<se_low>Yangus: Our enemy's in Neos, guv.
There ain't no point bein' 'ere now.
Come on!
<se_low>Yangus: Comin' 'ere makes me so 'eavy wiv regret that I can 'ardly walk.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't care how many times he knocks me down, I'll just keep on getting up again!
I'll never give up! Ever!

<se_high>Jessica: <Cap><hero>!
Let's go back to the Holy Isle of Neos!
We have to defeat Rhapthorne!

<se_high>Jessica: My guess is that the sceptre has fallen into Marcello's hands.
I can't be sure, but...call it a hunch.

<se_high>Jessica: Anyway, he isn't here.
Nowhere near here.
He's somewhere far, far away.
<se_def>Angelo: If we let him go now, he'll get himself established as the Lord High Priest.<page>Angelo: His guard will be so tight, we won't stand a chance of getting near him.
<se_def>Angelo: We've got one shot at defeating Marcello, and it's now. Let's go!

<se_def>Angelo: Marcello's taken care of all his rivals.
There's no one to stand in the way of him becoming the next Lord High Priest.<page>Angelo: It's just a matter of time now.

<se_def>Angelo: It's like some kind of sick joke.
He's been taken over by the Lord of Darkness and now he's going to become head of the Church!

<se_def>Angelo: Well, I'm not laughing. We're the only ones who know his...Rhapthorne's true character.
We have to do something.
<se_high>Jessica: Some people want to follow when their loved ones pass away.

<se_high>Jessica: Not me. I want to live as happy a life as I can.
I think of it as a way to honour those people whose lives were cut short.
<se_high>Jessica: Let's do our best to defeat Rhapthorne, so that we can all get on with our lives!

<se_low>Yangus: This place is quite 'igh up, eh?
Bit too close to Rhapthorne for my likin'.

<se_low>Yangus: We can only 'ope the Lord 'Igh Priest is watchin' over us.
Blimey, this place gives me the willies, though!
<se_def>Angelo: I'd never really conceived of the Lord High Priest having divine powers before.<page>Angelo: But it's quite impressive that he can give people support even in death.

<se_def>Angelo: I suppose it wouldn't hurt to say a little prayer, just for a laugh.<page>Angelo: Dear Lord High Priest, Angelo here.
May we defeat the Lord of Darkness.
Please.<page>Angelo: Thanks!
...Oh!
Amen.
<se_low>Yangus: So we've gotta find seven orbs, take 'em to Empyrea, an' then fight Rhapthorne.
<se_low>Yangus: ...It's knackerin' just thinkin' about it!
<se_high>Jessica: If we play the echo flute here, the guards will probably arrest us!
<se_high>Jessica: We don't need to play it everywhere. Only when we think we're near an orb.
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better hurry up and find the next orb. Otherwise Trode'll start to worry again.
<se_def>Angelo: The last time we were here to fight a dog, it ended up taking a month, after all. Our track record isn't good.
<se_low>Yangus: I 'ad a feelin' there'd be an orb 'ere, guv!
<se_low>Yangus: Come on, then! Let's 'ave it!
<se_high>Jessica: Wow! That was a loud echo! It must have given the church-goers a real surprise.
<se_def>Angelo: ...That must mean this is where the Lord High Priest died. Or rather, where he was murdered by someone......him.
<se_high>Red: Well, it ain't ev'ry day you get to see inside the Lord 'Igh Priest's residence, eh? I'll just 'ave a little poke around...
<se_high>Red: ...Wot? Come on, be serious! I ain't gonna be thinkin' about nabbin' any of 'is treasures, am I?
<se_high>Red: Not before I've seen wot 'e's got, any'ow! Heh heh heh!
<se_high>Red: There's a lot o' la-di-da types out there wot think they're the Goddess's gift to 'umanity, but are actually right so-an'-sos.
<se_high>Red: I wonder if the Lord 'Igh Priest is one of 'em... This is gonna be fun!
<se_low>Morrie: SCUSI! CIAO!
<se_low>Morrie: We do not want the Lord High Priest to think we are the burgers, ay? This is why I say the greeting so loud.
<se_low>Morrie: HELLO! SIGNOR!?
<se_low>Morrie: With this trespassing, we commit the crime and the sin in one foul swoop, ay? We must do what we are coming to do and make our getting away before the guards find us.
<se_high>Red: This place 'as got a diff'rent feel to it at night. There's somefin'...silvery about the place. An' I ain't talkin' about the moon!
<se_high>Red: Seriously, though, the view from up 'ere's top notch, eh? Yeah, I could get used to livin' in a place like this. It's got an elegance to it that appeals to someone like me.
<se_high>Red: There's a lot o' la-di-da types out there wot think they're the Goddess's gift to 'umanity, but are actually right so-an'-sos.
<se_high>Red: I wonder if the Lord 'Igh Priest is one of 'em... This is gonna be fun!
<se_low>Morrie: The Lord High Priest lives closer to the heavens than any other man in the world, ay? Si, from here, you can touch up the stars!
<se_low>Morrie: ...Che? You don't expect such romantic words from the mouth of Morrie Mozzarella? You should hear what I say to the girls in my pit!
<se_low>Morrie: With this trespassing, we commit the crime and the sin in one foul swoop, ay? We must do what we are coming to do and make our getting away before the guards find us.
<se_high>Red: Ha, 'e's got a nerve, eh? But I reckon all that's done is fan the flames of 'is ambition.
<se_high>Red: I dunno wot 'e's got up 'is sleeve, but that Marcello's one to watch, you mark my words.
<se_low>Morrie: This young man, he has the look of the rebellious youth in his eyes, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: When the adulti have this attitude, you never know what they are gonna do. He is a goose cannon, ay?
<se_high>Red: It's like 'e can see right inside me 'ead. Even I don't feel like I could get out a decent lie wiv them eyes of 'is borin' into me!

<se_low>Morrie: In front of the Lord High Padre <endash> such a great man <endash> I cannot find the words in my mouth.
I am spitless!
<se_high>Red: There's places we ain't explored yet then, eh? All right then! Let's go an' 'ave a shufti at this strange village, wotever that's s'posed to mean.
<se_low>Morrie: If this maid is not telling the false hoods, it means we can only get to this villagio by flying, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, leave it to us, ay, my friends! We take the bull with the horn and we go where the maid dreams to go!
<se_high>Red: There's places we ain't explored yet then, eh? All right then! Let's go an' 'ave a shufti at this strange village, wotever that's s'posed to mean.
<se_low>Morrie: If this maid is not telling the false hoods, it means we can only get to this villagio by flying, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Allora, leave it to us, ay, my friends! We take the bull with the horn and we go where the maid dreams to go!
<se_high>Red: We lost that cos we weren't tough enough. No two ways about it, unfortunately.
<se_high>Red: But we're on the up, eh? Gettin' tougher all the time. So it ain't gonna go that way next time, right? We're gonna teach that mutt a lesson!
<se_high>Red: I thought we'd done all right, catchin' up wiv that bleedin' mutt, but just look o' the mess 'e's made o' this place!
<se_high>Red: I'm tellin' ya, ya never know wot an animal like that's gonna do when ya get it cornered. Stay on yer toes, ev'ryone!
<se_high>Red: Wait, ain't that balcony comin' off where the...?
<se_high>Red: This ain't no time to be chattin' wiv yer mates! Come on, this is bad! RUN!
<se_high>Red: Wait, ain't that balcony comin' off where the...?
<se_high>Red: This ain't no time to be chattin' wiv yer mates! Come on, this is bad! RUN!
<se_low>Morrie: No! How can we lose?
<se_low>Morrie: Va bene! This is just the warming up, ay? In the next fight, we pull out all the shops!

<se_low>Morrie: PADREEEEEEEEE!
Have no fear! The cavalry is here!
<se_low>Morrie: The canine has smashed his way through the window! We have no time for loos!
<se_low>Morrie: We must run with our wind to the chamber of the Lord High Priest.
<se_low>Morrie: The canine has smashed his way through the window! We have no time for loos!
<se_low>Morrie: We must run with our wind to the chamber of the Lord High Priest.
<se_high>Red: That Marcello didn't look like 'e was bein' controlled like wot the dog was.
<se_high>Red: I'm thinkin' maybe that's 'is true colours, eh? Yeah, 'is true, stark ravin' bonkers colours.
<se_high>Red: So the Lord o' Darkness don't just pop up as soon as the last relative o' the sages is popped off then?
<se_high>Red: Looks like there's somefin' else that's gotta 'appen first before 'is resurrection, eh? Which means there's still time.
<se_low>Morrie: Is it the power of the sceptre that is so strong, or the power of signor Marcello...?
<se_low>Morrie: Whatever is the answer, we must be stronger, ay! We must have more POWER, more GUSTO and more PASSION!
<se_low>Morrie: I am not the great man like the Lord High Priest, but I know what we must do now.
<se_low>Morrie: Come! We go to stop the resurrecting of the Lord of the Darkness!
<se_high>Red: They don't come much more important than the Lord 'Igh Priest, eh? I mean, even someone as ‘open-minded’ as me can see that. It's like 'e's still watchin' down over us...

<se_high>Red: .........
Or maybe that's just wot we all wanna think, eh?
<se_low>Morrie: The Lord High Priest is sleeping inside this magnifico coffin, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Allora. We must use our GUSTO to defeat
the Lord of the Darkness, so the padre can
rest in pieces.
